results.title: Sundaze
results.creator_credit: Michael D. Carter and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: A simple animated film of Anne Graham’s line drawings of a sunny day at the beach. Illustrates the variety of occupations people follow on the beach, and implies that a summer day by the sea is one of the best ways of enjoying life. Dis-orienting use of sound lends further interest to this unconventional sociological survey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael D. Carter and State Film Centre of Victoria

results.title: Sunday by the sea
results.creator_credit: Anthony Simmons, Leon Clore and Harlequin Productions
results.brief_description: Watching a typical day at the Brighton seaside, we see how the Londoner enjoys himself on one of his favourite excursions. Ballads made famous in music halls take the place of commentary. Photography by Walter Lassally. (Awards: Grand Prix, Venice)

results.title: Sun Kosi: river of gold
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: Documents the progress of the 1981 Australian Himalayan Kayak Expedition down the 340 kilometre Sun Kosi River of Nepal. The first attempt to paddle the river, the trip combined danger and discovery as the men tackled the treacherous elements in a land untouched by the pressures of the Western world. Suitable for lower and middle secondary level.

results.title: Sun flight
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermot, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: An animated recounting of the ancient Greek myth of Daedalus and Icarus. Portrays the creation of the Labyrinth on Crete, the imprisonment of Daedalus and Icarus by King Minos, the construction of wings for their escape, and the tragic flight of Icarus to the sun. Stylised graphic design, intensive colour and exciting music are used.

results.title: Summit seekers: the ascent of Sterling Peak, New Zealand
results.brief_description: Shows the mighty ranges of New Zealand’s Southern Alps, a tumultuous ocean of snows, present on all sides and the alpine pioneers who are courageous enough to climb these icy slopes. Mt Sterling is the highest peak.

results.title: Summer of the seventeenth doll [discussion]
results.brief_description: Peter Fitzpatrick from Monash University is an expert on Ray Lawler’s play. He looks at its dramatic heritage and how the play farewells the myth of the male bush hero by showing what hapens when the old values of the outback hero and urban domesticity are in conflict.

results.title: Summer of the seventeenth doll [Australian Opera]
results.brief_description: Ray Lawler’s classic play, set in Melbourne in the 1950’s, is brought to life in this operatic adaptation recorded at the Playhouse, Victorian Arts Centre. Cast includes Elizabeth Campbell, Gillian Sullivan, Natalie Jones, Eilene Hannan, Barry Ryan, Gary Rowley and Nicholas Todorovic. Music by the Victorian State Opera is composed and conducted by Richard Mills. Performance produced and directed by Peter Butler.
